I tagged alone to get some writing done. Stayed in room on Club Level. Room was average. Club lounge was staffed by some very attentive employees (the highlight of the stay) but did not have the level of amenities I expected. Also, It seemed that many people not staying at club level were accessing the lounge and carting away food. The hotel is a very good mid-level choice. The only caveat is that at night the location is quite unsafe. But, during the day, it is in an area near very fine restaurants and attractions, e.g., the Atlanta Aquarium.

11393668434COB4232534True34FalseFalse3Raleigh, NC, USA9/[YEAR-1]10/1/[YEAR-0]4What happened to "you belong?"Over the past 10 years, I've really enjoyed staying at this property. However, because the turnover is excessive, it is rare to see a familiar face at check-in or during my stay. Therefore, if there are issues that need attention, you are generally not treated as a loyal patron unless a certain customer service/front desk manager is on duty. For the most part, the newly hired front desk staff are friendly and courteous; however, if customer service/front desk managers are rude and uncompromising, the front desk staff will think it's okay to treat patrons that way. I realize that customers are not always right, but loyalty should always be considered.

11394623460havebusinesswilltravel14144False24FalseFalse4Utah/Cali/Wa9/[YEAR-0]10/1/[YEAR-0]The service is terrible. If you like BPG properties dont stay here, it will sour you to the entire brand.4Nice hotel, Nice location, Terrible service.Shame on me but I thought we would give the Seattle Belvoir another try. It seems like every time we stay here its something. I generally have a good stay at Belvoirs, and I am a platinum Grandbourne member so obviously I stay at Grandbourne quite a bit. All that being said I will NEVER stay at this hotel again unless God forbid its the only option, then I will dread every moment leading to the stay. I booked a room at this hotel for 4 nights. At check in I was thanked for my platinum status but not offered a welcome gift, (points, etc.) and I was told we were in a room with a double bed. I was traveling with my wife, kids stayed home, so I asked for a king bed. The staff looked at the computer and said "I am sorry sir, but our king rooms are totally sold out for the entire length of your stay I found this hard to believe so I asked, are you sure? "Yes sir, totally booked so I pulled up my BPG mobile app and checked, there are all kinds of king rooms available. I show the gentleman what about all these king rooms, I can get online and book one right now that is available. Now I am pretty calm, but I was pretty irritated that I had been lied to. The desk person says "let me check" goes back behind the check in wall and comes back and says "we can put you in a king room Honestly? After all that? Most hotels make me feel like staying exclusively at Grandbourne properties is a good idea and take care of us; The Belvoir downtown Seattle always, Always makes me regret it. Do yourself a favor and book a different BPG property.

11403683434Librarian1844545True53FalseFalse1Gaffney, SC9/[YEAR-0]10/2/[YEAR-0]Great location for conference, but not for shopping.2Great Hotel for ConferenceMy husband and I spent three nights at the Belvoir Downtown Raleigh, while I attended a conference there. Our room was nice and clean, although a little small. Everything worked fine, except the fan in the bathroom was a little noisy, and was not on a separate switch from the light. The conference facilities were wonderful. No problems finding the rooms for the workshops and sessions, and the food furnished by the hotel was really good. While there are many restaurants nearby, there are no "convenience" stores or drug stores open later in the day or after lunch on Saturday to get toiletries, sodas or snacks. Everything closes early, which is really strange.There is literally no shopping nearby. Lots of museums within walking distance, though. Three blocks from Amtrak, so it is very convenient for that type of travel. Overall, it was a good experience.

I was booked into the Belvoir Los Angeles Downtown by a colleague, mainly due to the location and the discounted industry rate. I was quicky reminded why I vowed not to stay at Belvoir hotels. The bathroom was dingy, paint peeling by the ceiling, with no washcloths. There was a broken thermostat on the wall and the room was too hot. The bed was reasonably comfortable and the only worthwhile aspect of the room. The wi-fi was additional fee and slow. I could hear people in the hallway, as if they were inside my room. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and had I encouraged a client to use the hotel, I would be fired.

114182831113JustPassingThrough33324False54FalseFalse2Anchorage, AK, USA9/[YEAR-0]10/3/[YEAR-0]Lovely courtyard1Maybe not the best for a tired one night stop-overI stayed just one brief night between a long day of road travel and a long day of air travel. So I was tired and perhaps not very tolerant. Nevertheless, I was dismayed to find, after I had returned my rental car, that the hotel does not offer a shuttle service to and from the airport. The additional $45 for a taxi each way seemed like a significant extra expense I had not anticipated. Further, I found the room, though with ample space, to be poorly lit and with a fairly antiquated air conditioning system. There was someone else's hair on the bedroom vanity. The bathroom was small with only a standard residential bathtub (with a drain plug that would not stay open for the use of the shower). The decor of the room seemed outdated to me. When I called to report that I could not access my room because my key cards would not work, I was placed on hold, after which I was told someone would come to help me. When this person arrived, he tested my keycards himself (as if I was mistaken), then asked to see my identification before opening my door for me. He then said that I would have to take my keycards back down to the front desk to have them fixed. I agreed to the terms and fee to access the wireless internet but after returning from having the keycards fixed, the internet was no longer available. I called for help and was transferred to tech support where I was on hold for about 10 minutes. As soon as someone came on the line, the internet modem showed up and I was able to log back on. I made 4 calls from my room to toll-free numbers, yet I was charged $2.29 for each of these toll-free calls. Perhaps because I was there over a Saturday night, at some time of the early evening, music could be heard in my room, coming from the courtyard side. I do not know the source.

I believe the other room had a few minor upgrades that our room did not have like bathrobes, makeup mirror, etc. Overall our stay was wonderful! Would definately recommend or stay again!

114235301115ronton34344True32FalseFalse4Calgary, AB, Canada9/[YEAR-0]10/4/[YEAR-0]if you can avoid it (it is hard to avoid) stay away from the flat rate transportation, it is more expensive than a regular cab4Typical Airport Belvoir HotelI have stayed here numerous times when travelling to Fort Lauderdale on Business. My biggest pet peeve with this hoel, and it will prbably prevent me from staying here again, is the bell desk. For some unknown reason they will not call cabs for you, but seem to have a network of their friends that they get to drive you ether in a 15 pax van, or in their personal vehicles, and it is always more expensive than taking a metered taxi. Having been taken for a ride before by this service, and really not liking not having a choice, I pushed a little harder for a metered taxi at which point the bell desk jut got rude with me. Again I consider this unacceptable for a Belvoir. I'm not sure what kind of kickback they are getting from these people in their own vehicles, but I feel like I am in some 3rd world country, not in the US.

11464882994MRCLEAN33232False42FalseFalse4Miami, FL, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/7/[YEAR-0]BAD Customer Service4MAINTENANCE ISSUESI checked into my first room and found the room to be very warm and the AC was running. I looked at the AC Filter and saw that it was filthy, it looked as though it had not been changed in months. I called downstairs to ask for the manager to come up and take a look. She came up stairs with the Director of Maintenance who stated that they keep a record book and that it was changed recently. I stated that if it was changed recently then you have got huge problems with dirt and dust in this hotel because a filter does not get that dirty in a matter of a couple of months. It was so bad you could not even see through the filter when held up to the light. Anyway, they change the filter and dont offer me anything. So next I get settled and unpacked and try to use the internet, to my surprise the internet was not working. I called downstairs and was told they would call the technician to see what was going on. About 1 hour later still not working, just in my room, rest of the hotel was ok. So, they move me to another room. Now I have to get all of my belongings together and make the move. We check the internet and its ok. I get settled again, go to dinner come back and try to use the TV, the remote control does not work. I call back downstairs and they send a maintenance man up. He changes the batteries in the remote, then changes remotes all together. Now it works but you have to push the up down button at least twice to change the channel and same thing with the volume. We go back and forth with this and finally I had enough and tell him to leave, I will deal with it. I go to lie down in bed and now the remote will not work at all. The maintenance man comes back up and he gets it to work but he is standing up right in front of the TV. I tell him that it should work from lying down. He states to me no, thats the way it works. I must get up out of bed, stand in front of the TV to change the channel anytime I want to change the channel. This is now very comical, if this was not happening to me I would not belive it. The maintenance man actually said, You need to get up, stand in front of the TV every time you want to change the channel or move the volume I kid you not. I had enough of this guy, so I call downstairs and speak to a front desk clerk; I ask her does she think that I should have to do this every time I need to change the channel. She actually states to me sir, if thats what maintenance says then thats what you need to do I ask her, yes I know what they said but Im asking you does this sound right. She states yes. I have to give it to them, they all stick together, no matter how stupid they are.

114720913616primus9734332True34FalseFalse2Stamford, CT, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/8/[YEAR-0]The employees generally provide great service, but the quality of the facilities can vary.3Room Quality Left a Lot to Be DesiredLet me start out by saying the bed WAS actually comfortable, even though I didn't get the room type I requested when I made the reservation. Once I finished unpacking and had taken off my shoes, I stepped in a damp spot in the carpet. I noticed that the damp spot was in front of a door in the chest of drawers/TV stand. When I opened the door, I found a mini-fridge sitting open with a big puddle in front of it. Also, I looked at the nightstand, and there was no alarm clock. Finally, I tried to plug in my phone to charge it, and the plugs in the desk didn't work (they were too loose to hold the plug). All of these problems were eventually fixed, but I have to wonder if the Housekeeping Supervisor or Assistant Manager have adequate room inspection procedures. I will stay here again, but not in that room.
11472119353Guest0000133223True33FalseFalse4New Orleans, LA9/[YEAR-0]10/8/[YEAR-0]While under renovation they were still not at 100% in their customer service in several areas. Location is good but room rate and customer service would leave me looking for another hotel in the area for another stay in New Orleans.3Good location but lack customer service quality for the priceWhile under renovation the staff were not at 100% in their customer service in several areas. Location is good but room rate and customer service would leave me looking for another hotel in the area for another stay in New Orleans. While I had a newly renovated room the bathroom was left with what appeared to be women's hair all over the counter and floor. I requested room service on day one but declined day two and three to get the points voucher but they cleaned my room anyway and still did not get all the hair cleaned up. There were no filters for the coffee pot to make tea, the bottled waters in the room were not free and was not noted anywhere on the tags placed on the bottles you would be charged for them. Breakfast was rather pricey for an omlet (good flavor), toast and coffee for $25. I took a chance and ordered the same meal twice and had different food quality and presentation both times, unfortunately day two was worse than day one. The water main break was an inconvenience but happened at the most inopportune time for those of us who get ready between 6:30 and 7:30 in the morning. The hotel manager did provide a letter of apology for the inconvenience but no room rate deduction or comps were given. The concierge on duty the evening of Oct 2 was not very helpful or resourceful in making reservations for our party of 8. I was able to find my own reservations using open table app on my Blackberry and turned out to be our best meal of the week! While the hotel itself is under renovation and offers a very nice atmosphere, the staff and management need to step up their game to offer the best in class serivce a hotel of their caliber and locale demand.

11493132468Sun[YEAR-0]54545True36TrueFalse2Boston, MA, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/9/[YEAR-0]The Dolphin is in a perfect location4Our Favorite place to stay in OrlandoWe have been coming to the WDW Dolphin for over 17 years now. We have stayed at other properties in Orlando but nothing compares to the Dolphin. It has all of the conveniences of a Disney property (location, extra magic hours, Character Breakfasts, Park Transportation). However, it feels like you are staying at a top hotel away from all of the Disney craziness. The location is fantastic (on the Boardwalk), the spa, restaurants, and rooms are like no other at Disney. We can't wait to go back and plan to return within the year. It is by far our favorite place to stay in Orlando.

114992171552Leland335342True42FalseFalse2Riverside, CA, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/9/[YEAR-0]It is in a good location for either work or vacation stays.2Starting to show wear...We have stayed at this hotel before, prefer to stay at Belvoir's as they provide a level of relaxation as soon as you hit the door and we usually stay for 5+ days. However, there were a few problems with this hotel we hadn't encountered before. The first, the parking area is being used as a parking lot for off of property events. The area was coned so you had to drive behind the hotel (past the trash, etc...) to get to the front. Also the parking behind the hotel was so hap-hazard, we had to weave around parked cars to get through. Upon entering the lobby, there was a water dispenser (as it was 108 degress that day.) At 3PM, the dispenser was empty. At check in, we informed the lobby staff and they said they would take care of it. As we left for dinner at 6PM, the dispenser was still empty, the sliced orange still stuck in the same place on the side of the glass container. We stayed on the 5th floor and as we walked to our room, we couldn't notice how dirty the carpets were, you could see the paths to each of the doorways. Also there were scuff marks almost the entire length of the walls from either the maid carts or baggage carts being dragged along them. Finally upon checkout, we were unable to exit the driveway due to the parking lot issue. The exit gate was closed and the attendant told use to use our room key. When we told him we had just checked out and showed him our parking pass, we were told we had to go back to the front desk and get a card so we could exit. Upon returning to the front desk, they told me I had the parking pass and the parking attendant should have let us out. We returned to the gate and waited until the attendant returned who then let us out without an apology. Even with these issues the hotel room was clean and comfortable which is most important. We did bring these issues to the attention of the staff who responded with an "ok." This is a new hotel that gives the look of a much older property...

When I said I had not eaten in the restaurant, I was asked where I had eaten, what I had had for breakfast, and was asked that twice! When I told the agent that I was on the club level and breakfast is available in the lounge, I was asked again what I had eaten in the lounge! It was rather embarassing and insulting to be questioned about an item on the bill for which I was not responsible. I wanted to say to him -- why would I go all the way down to G's for a $35 breakfast when I can go across the hall and sit quietly in the lounge and enjoy a decent breakfast as part of my room rate? So...I'm not very happy with that part of my stay. The conference section was superb and all the staff there were extremely helpful and courteous and professional.

1150229619JoeS244454True66FalseFalse1Carson City, NV, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/9/[YEAR-0]Great location, noisy airconditioning4Good, convenient hotel with loud airconditionerI stayed at the Belvoir Bradley Airport Hotel because I arrived very late, and the hotel was very conveniently located. Plus, I've found that Belvoirs are usually quality hotels. This one is no exception. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are clean and pleasant, and the airport location is ideal for people arriving on very late flights. My only complaint was that the airconditioner in the room was extremely loud and kept cycling all night. Since it was too warm to turn the thing off, there was not much I could do about it except endure it and settle for a less than restful night's sleep. It always amazes me that otherwise quality hotels don't invest in quiet, central air conditioning systems.

11515287468red444534True3FalseFalse110/[YEAR-0]10/10/[YEAR-0]Fantastic Amenities, Average RoomsMy stay at the Dolphin was a great experience for myself, out to have fun. There are over a dozen places to eat and free shuttles to the Disney Parks, including some cool water taxi's to a couple of the parks via the hotel's own waterways. The Boardwalk is short distance away by foot, and multiple pools are enhanced with a cabana bar, waterfall slides, and miniature "beach". This is a hotel for the visitor that wants to be out and about, though had I left the vicinity of Disney, it would be quite a bit of a drive. The room size was completely satisfactory, just a little bit less "fantastic" than I thought the hotel would contain based on the amenities they offer. Cleaniness was a little off here and there...for instance, the first day/night, my floor was sticky in the entryway (not sure if it was from cleaning product or just dirty) and there was a cup/mug ring on the dresser. Morning came and I wanted to make myself a coffee, opened the machine to start the heating, and the stagnant water it began to boil filled my room with the smell of mildew for a day and a half or more; no idea how long the water had been in there prior to my arrival. I had housekeeping remove it, but I never got a replacement. This is the only 'bad' customer service I received in the hotel. Service and staff were impeccably friendly and more than helpful, going out of their way to make sure I was accomodated, even if I didn't know I wanted to be! This is definitely a place perfect for those that want to be out of their room in the Parks until bed time and enjoy good eats.

115162551727Antonio11121False56FalseFalse4LA10/[YEAR-0]10/10/[YEAR-0]STAY ELSEWHERE4Location, location & ......locationThe location is ideal, with many subway lines to Manhattan and walking distance to the new Barclay Center. Unfortunately, its location is also a curse, as the electronic/dub step music from the rooftop bar permeates the pores of the hotel until 3 am, making it impossible to sleep. When we arrived (on Friday am), we discovered (as others have said) its next to impossible to secure a room upgrade (NB As a Platinum BPG member, this is the first time I have not been upgraded in 2 + years). The action in the bar also explains why the elevators are so slow (we waited for 10 minutes on two occasions on Saturday). Its because the hotel dedicates 2 of its elevators to the bar, including the service elevator, forcing its own staff to use the public lifts! Housekeeping was pretty iffy - we had to ask for everything! The staffing in the BPG lounge was spotty - they opened late & were inattentive when supplies ran out! The final straw came on Sunday, when after a night with zero sleep, there was no hot water to be had! We checked out early (a first!) and went to another hotel! (Mid-level management did not adequately respond to service concerns, another signal that all is not right @ the Belvoir Brooklyn).

11516564171MDGirl55554True45FalseFalse3Bowie, MD, USA9/[YEAR-0]10/10/[YEAR-0]Great staff, hotel and location4Great Hotel with Great LocationMy room was GREAT! I had a balcony that had a city view AND my bed faced the water - I had the best of both worlds! The hotel is right off of the highway and is river-front (I think it is the James River). The hotel literally sits in the midst of so much American History. You must walk the Board Walk and stop along the way to look at the bronzed letters (this will make sense once you get there). I loved the Owner's Club Lounge; had a nice variety and was open every time I needed a snack. The had drinks, fruit and yogurt available at all times; evening appetizers and a nice breakfast. The lounge overlooks the water, has plenty of seating, flat screen tv, computer AND printer. The gym is small but nice and clean with a temperature controlled "cooler" with small hand cloths. The outdoor pool was nice and it had lounge chairs which needed to be updated. I thought the pool areas was a little "dated". Check-in was a little longer than expected but it was well worth the wait. The staff is extremely accommodating and actually came from behind the desk and handed me my room keys (I cannot remember his name, but it had a very unique spelling). I opted to self-park in the garage ($8.00 with the Belvoir discount); the last time I stayed, parking was free (of course it has been at least 1 year). Norfolk has rich history and has done a nice job in preserving it. aI highly recommend the Belvoir in Norfolk.

Upon check in I asked and was told internet service was included in my room rate, on check out I was charged $13.95 each day for internet. Again I had to ask this to be removed. I can understand one bill error, I am concerned when there are 3.

115325511569HMommy44555True36FalseFalse1Hawaii, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/11/[YEAR-0]If you don't mind being a little further from the parks, then this hotel is the perfect choice for clenlinessand comfort.1Clean, Comfortable, greatWe enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were very well kept and clean. We liked having lots of pillows, the complimentary water was a fabulous unexpected amenity and the staff was very helpful. Our first night we realized we had a leak in the bathroom causing a small puddle. We are pretty easy so we just called the front desk to alert them and said it was fine to us as long as it didn't get worse but just wanted them to know. They sent maintenance right away. He brought us extra towels for the floor and told us he would have it fixed first thing in the morning, which he did. The front desk was always pleasant as were the valets and porters. My son ended up with a collection of stuffed animals from Disneyland and the housekeepers would always arrange them nicely on his bed for him. He enjoyed that. Overall, it was a great hotel and experience. We chose to walk to Disneyland every day which was about 10-15 minutes depending on crowd and crosswalk lights. We could also walk to Garden Walk for dinner. We never used the ART but the hotel hasa nice sitting area for it to stop at right out front. The laundry room was great to have, although, it took us almost 3 hours to do a load because we had to run the dryer twice to get clothes fully dry. That was a bummer to have to sit there that long with nothing to do. Finally, the snack shop was a great option although pricey. We wish Molly's Kitchen was open for dinner because Overland seemed very dead and the food wasn't that great. We would definitely stay here again.

It was a Garden Room on the 4th floor. The big problem was the A/C unit, which sounded like a jet engine. We complained on night #1, they said they would have engineering look at it. Problem was not fixed. We complained again. The front desk informed us that this was a "new" A/C unit and are much louder. So, they knew about this problem but yet did not move us when we originally complained. This front desk clerk, immediately changed our room to one with a quieter A/C unit and credited our resort fee for our entire stay. That was much appreciated.

The rooms are relatively spacious, but the furniture, walls, carpeting, etc. show their age all too well. On the positive, the air conditioning was effective. 115531921162tourgal2145455True02TrueTrue2Georgia, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/13/[YEAR-0]They add extra fees without telling you.4Don't like surprisesThe hotel was wonderful! The Staff was great while we were at the hotel! Everything was Great! When I got home and looked at my receipt I discovered a Resort Fee which I was not made aware of along with a Parking fee again which I was not made aware of. Being in the hospitality business I find these fees as a "money grab" and am highly put off by extra fees. If you want to raise your rates do so, but don't keep adding unknown fees. What did I get for the Resort Fee? NOTHING that I know of. Valet Parking - yes my car was parked and I got two bottles of ice cold water when we checked out. Neither of which I think is worth $15 when the parking lot was within steps of the front door. Had I known this I would have parked my car myself. I loved the hotel and the renovation is superb, but I may have to think twice about staying myself and putting my groups at the hotel. I am a tour operator and was looking for some new hotels in the Orlando area. I had met one of your sales people in Jacksonville the week before and thought I'd try out the hotel on her recommendations. It is easy to add extra charges when customers pay with a credit card and then they are in a hurry in the morning and don't take the time to look at the bill at the time.

11566382379Lisa12832231False28FalseFalse2Brooklyn, NY, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/14/[YEAR-0]This hotel does not have a spa. Also, upgrade to rooms in buildings near beach and pool.3A bit deceiving from online site...however, great locationThey advertise recently renovated, however, they fail to mention that there are many buildings within the Belvoir Kauai and not all have been renovated and if they have, I'm sure they spent more money on the main building which houses the pool, restaurants/bar. If your in the other buildings it's as if you're an outcast with your own pool that has no food or beverage options. They also advertise the Rainforest Spa. The spa doesn't exist. I found this out after the front desk sent me looking for the "spa" in my building and after searching around I asked the Salon staff and found out the spa was actually in a hotel room - the one below my room. The pillows were flat and uncomfortable and the bathroom was extremely dim. The shower also had no water pressure (an issue I heard among many guests). We also were put in a room that had no towels and were told it would be a few hours to get them (another issue shared among guests) In the rooms we had no cell service and terrible wifi. Most of the time you loose connection. As far as food - in the book of guest services it states that breakfast is from 7:30-10:30am (pretty early considering the times of all other hotels) - found out the hard way that they changed their hours to 7:30am-9:30am - even worse and we missed breakfast. When we finally made it to Rum Fire for breakfast the next day it was a good 15 minutes before we were asked what we would like to drink...another 15 minutes before we got our coffee and juice. And, much later before we got our food. Needless to say, we did not go there for dinner due to terrible service. Luckily, we found The Shops at Kukui ula and stumbled upon amazing food places for a quarter of the prices at the Belvoir. The location of the actual main pool on the beach was beautiful. Due to the lack of amenities (spa, room service -which doesn't serve breakfast fyi) I would not stay there again. We were on our honeymoon and expected to relax in a spa, not have to rush out for breakfast and were very disappointed.

115771953052td9943443True44FalseFalse4Arlington, VA, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/15/[YEAR-0]4Great StaffI've stayed here a couple times and stayed at comparable Grandbourne hotels in NYC and the Tribeca Belvoir does a great job with service. They just seem genuine about treating you like a person/guest rather than a number. It's also a bit smaller so you feel a bit of relief from the swarms of people at larger hotels or certain areas of the city. I think this also makes a difference in the perceived stress level of the staff. They seem to be less annoyed and more welcoming than other hotels. The rooms are comfortable and serviceable. The showers are walk-in - which I prefer rather than stepping over a bath tub and they are a little bit roomier. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

115933285601rakuhn45255True56FalseFalse3Charlotte NC10/[YEAR-0]10/15/[YEAR-0]Location and units are quite good but customer service can be improved to Grandbourne levels.4Customer Service Needs ImprovementWe agree completely with a previous reviewer who concluded this property's staff needs to run more like a Grandbourne Hotel for customer service and less like a time-share. We are BPG gold members and owners at Maui but chose to pay cash for a 5 night stay at Belvoir Broadway Plantation in Myrtle Beach. We booked an AARP nightly rate which included a $75 resort credit with a stay of four nights or more. At check in, we were given no paperwork...no confirmation of nightly rate, no mention of the resort credit and were required to get our parking pass from vacation services (aka timeshare sales appointments) before our room keys would be issued. We returned to the front desk after unloading our luggage (about an hour later )to confirm our nightly rate and inquire about the resort credit. We were informed there are no resort amenties toward which a resort credit could be used and offered a $50 gift card to a local restaurant. I opted to call BPG customer serice and was eventually contacted by the front desk manager who confirmed there were no resort amenities to use for a resort credit but again offered a $50 gift card to a local restaurant. Front desk manager finally agreed to provide us with a $75 gift card (we think to get rid of us) but did not seem particularly concerned that nightly rates, including a resort credit, continue to be posted on BPG.com.

I have over 27,000 BPG points and am 10 stays away from gold membership (of 25). I feel like an hour of complementary internet is not a huge request. However, that is not what I am venting about, it was that the manager said it was not possible to apply complementary service in the room. As a computer scientist, as a guest in other Belvoirs, I know that it IS possible. The inaccurate information given by the manager was frustrating. I did change hotel rooms the next day. And I would advise you to look around just a little bit more to find a more suitable hotel.

116447221291Austonian55555True37FalseFalse4Austin, TX, USA9/[YEAR-0]10/17/[YEAR-0]4Outstanding Historic Hotel Near AlamoThis is currently my favorite hotel in Texas for a number of reasonsbut primarily because of the superb job the Belvoir has done in honoring the history of this century-old building and retaining the old world charm. I was upgraded to the Governors Suite, which Ill admit was very kind of the hotel, but the other rooms are equally as nice. The Governors Suite was large and spacious. I especially liked the heavy wooden shutters that you could open in the mornings and close in the evenings. While sitting in the lobby, it felt like you were in the early 1900swith all the hard wood, marble floors and antique chandeliers. The Alamo is only about a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and the River Walk is equally as close.

11662973468Ryan8855555True26FalseFalse3Gainesville, FL, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/18/[YEAR-0]Their own food and wine event looks like a blast.1Can't be beat for Food and WineReserved two rooms for my wife and I, our 5-month old, and my in-laws. Last time at Dolphin was three years prior. First pair of rooms were far from the elevator, so requested closer rooms. Lost the balconies, but was moved to a fantastic room (more like junior suite) right next to the elevators that adjoined to the in-laws room. There was an A/C problem, but the staff fixed it in no time. We stayed for two nights. Friday night, the Swan and Dolphin had their own Food and Wine event with live music and lots of good food and wine. We had to navigate through to get to the boardwalk, but it looked like fun had we not had our 5-month old with us. On Sat, took the ferry to Epcot, spent 6 great hours eating and drinking through the park, and took the ferry back. Super convenient. Ate a snack on site and breakfast on Sunday. The prices were high, but to be expected. I must give the hotel credit for allowing Grandbourne members to waive the resort fee in lieu of bonus points, and providing free wifi. I always hated those extra expenses. Booked the room with points too, so only expenses at the hotel were parking and dining. Didn't get to use the pool or fitness center, but they looked amazing. Not waiting three more years to come back! We all had a great time and I forgot what a nice property it was.

116815881774SaltLakeCityScott55True63FalseFalse1Duluth, MN10/[YEAR-0]10/19/[YEAR-0]If you want a view, be sure to request a lakeside room2hotel excellent - club level a disappointmentI recently traveled with a colleague who had mobility issues, and so booked the club floor to allow easy access for breakfast. The food offerings in the club were minimal, with limited offerings and really below par pastry choices. The attendant seemed not to have been trained and was invisible most of the time we were there for breakfast. The second morning we opted to eat in the hotel's main floor restaurant, which is well run and serves above average food. The dinner there the night before was truly excellent, and the service was as well. The whole hotel facility was very attractive and well-maintained. The views on the city-side rooms, however, are not city views but rather look out on the hotel parking facility. I attend a meeting in Duluty every year, and next fall will request a lake view room not on the club level.

That's not welcoming for a Gold member. The ventilation system is quite loud, and The location is far, not walking distance, to downtown Burlington. There are other hotels right near the water with updated accommodations. BPG should consider opening a hotel closer to downtown. I only stayed here because I'm an BPG Gold member, but if I weren't, I would have easily chosen another hotel.
118843451523Tx11333355True23FalseTrue1Texas, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/21/[YEAR-0]Very convenient to the convention center4Growing painsI'm not sure how old this hotel is, but it has a few improvements to make in order for me to ever consider coming back. We pretty much took over the hotel and it was obvious that there would be peak times when more staff was needed but this was not thought through at all. I called down to have maintenance fix it, but I explained to him that it still was not fixed. That was not huge issue, but it was not resolved. Secondly, my next stay was 10/14 - 18/[YEAR-0], and I noticed that the stay well/eat well booklet is out of date. The channel listing is out of date and the room service menu is also out of date. I called down after a long day at work to order room service, and nothing from the late menu was available in the hotel. The Room Service agent explained to me that the menu's in the room are out-dated and that the hotel no longer serves those items. Overall, I really like this hotel, there are just some upgrades that need to happen, or remove the booklets and re-print a temporary menu and channel listing or anything else in the booklet that may now be out-of-date.

Maybe this is part of the hotel's attempt to conserve energy, and if so, it would be a good thing. 119145921021phoenix141455555True44FalseFalse3Orlando, FL, USA7/[YEAR-0]10/23/[YEAR-0]Refurbished; great location; pet friendly4Refurbished; great location; pet friendlyI travel to Tampa often and have stayed in this hotel several times over the past 8 years. It was challenging staying during the renovations, but well worth the wait. The refurbished rooms are great. Upper floors (BPG?) are hardwood. I usually travel alone (except for my dogs) for business, but the 2 room suite would be excellent for multiple people or a family. The rooms have all the amenities you could ask for: fridge. microwave, lounge area, large workspace, 2 TVs. The bar is decent. Breakfast is so-so (it's a hot breakfast buffet, but overpriced for the quality of the food). Front desk staff and housekeeping is very friendly. I would recommend this hotel and stay again.

Elite status is often overlooked by all staff and you have to ask repeatedly for your amenities, like free wifi. When dealing with the front desk you would think the lines for all BPG properties ring there and the staff at the front desk prioritizes phone calls over dealing with guests. On top of this, my most recent trip to the property was on business and there was a reduced room rate. However, I was traveling with colleagues and knew we would be working on some projects and requested a larger room via the phone a few days prior. They said I would have a larger room on the club level. When I arrived the room was no different than those I was traveling with and yet I was paying an extra $90/night for the Club Level. When I inquired at the front desk (after waiting for the phone calls to end) I was told they would check with the manager and contact me. Never heard a word from them. I believe in the BPG brand but when I travel to Des Moines for business in the future I will seek a different property.

119255011569spedteach2555554True56FalseFalse3Anaheim, CA, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/23/[YEAR-0]Within walking distance to a lot of restaurants, shops, and Disneyland, California Adventures,3A Very Nice Hotel!My two sisters and I recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be very nice. It was clean and housekeeping exchanged our towels daily. The bathroom with the sink is a little small, especially for three women trying to get ready. It was the only place with a mirror. It would have been nice to have a mirror in another place in the room. Our tv did not work when we first got there. We called the front desk and someone came and fixed it within 10 minutes. We never had any more trouble with it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, Downtown Disney, and Disneyland. Breakfast was not provided, so we just went to the shop on the first floor and got a muffin or breakfast sandwich. It was a little expensive, but the food was good. We ordered room service the last night we were there; and the food was good as well. Overall, our experience was well worth the stay. We were pleased with the accommodations and would definitely stay here again.

One of the front desk staff was extremely rude in his tone vocally and with facial expressions from eye rolling to sneering when asked about room preparation for check-in and about way to get to a room in the C building because he had to repeat both answers. One of the most important qualities of a hotel is front desk which give the first impression to guests upon arrival and sadly to say the physical hotel can be beautiful and perfect but the personnel behind the desk is what makes a guest comfortable and eager to return when in the area again. Your hotel failed this test and I would not repeat a visit nor recommend your place to anyone traveling to the area.

11942786756G54033445554True54FalseFalse2Atlanta, GA, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/25/[YEAR-0]Faces the Mass Pike ... ask for a room on the opposite side2Ask for an Room Opposite the Mass PikeThe staff treated me very well and the appointments of the room were excellent, including a very comfortable mattress and bedding. I was generally pleased with my stay. Having said that, a few things annoyed me. First, my room faced the freeway and I was aware of the traffic noise all night. Trucks especially interfered with my sleep. Ask for a room not facing the traffic. Second, my room faced the floodlights on the front of the hotel. The curtains had a liner that blocked the light out well, which is ok if you prefer a dark cave rather than being able to see out. I like the gradual lightening in the morning as the sun rises. Third, the main elevator's doors didn't close until having been open for several minutes. There is another set of elevators not far from the first one. One of the staff told me it was to be replaced and signs had been posted pointing to the second set. Perhaps they would do better to advise guests not to use that elevator.

11960029421Casinochips55455True36FalseFalse4Los Angeles, CA, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/26/[YEAR-0]Perfect for family3Great Hotel!!! A Must Stay!My family and I had a great experience at this property on our last trip there. We have stayed there many times and on our most recent stay we were really pleased with how well we were accommodated by the front desk at check-in. Our room was by far the best we have stayed in at the property. I told the person checking us in that we were traveling with children and they gave a really nice big room. I love the club lounge at this hotel and the staff up there is really great. They always recognize us and give us great service. We had a small water leak in the room and the front desk sent a maintenance person up very quickly to address the problem and all was resolved. My only complaint after staying here many times over the years is that the lobby bar closes too early on Fridays and Saturdays and the lobby bar staff are not as welcoming as the staff in the club lounge. When we come to NYC with the kids we always stay here. Overall, this property is in perfect proximity to other bars, the subway, Broadway shows, times square and central park. BPG really treats their members well and that's why we bought into an ownership share. We will definitely be back to this Belvoir in December. Thanks for making it a great family trip to the big apple!

I would love it if they had an airport shuttle, but that is the only negative. The property, pool, rooms, staff and location make this a must stay venue.

She informed me that I was wrong and that she was completely unable to change my reservation. Unfortunately, I was not very satisfied at this juncture in the transaction. I went to the parking lot to retrieve my reservation from my car. Upon return, I waited in line (again) and was helped by the same employee. She carefully examined the printout for my hotel reservation and realized I was correct. She never apologized for the misunderstanding or even commented on her mistake. She checked me in, after giving her my identification and credit card again, and sent me on my way without even a thank you. 1[YEAR-8]248166Phili1sttimer54555True6FalseFalse210/[YEAR-0]10/29/[YEAR-0]See review aboveStaff was terrific at this hotel.Location and the availability of an offered special were the reasons we decided to try this property. We were very happy with the location...only a few blocks from Independence Mall. It is in a quieter area than some of the other conveniently located hotels, too, which we found pleasant. The gentleman who checked us in at the desk gets an A++ for professionalism, friendliness, and great service. We found the rest of the staff good too. Rooms looked very clean. I had wished there was a small fridge or microwave in the room for convenience, but the way things worked out the lack of these amenities wasn't much of an issue. I absolutely love that the property is 100% smoke free - getting stuck in a smoking room is a deal breaker for us and when all rooms are nonsmoking you don't have to worry about that happening. There was a wedding one night we were there and it was noisy...the walls seem not very soundproof and we could hear not only the wedding music into the night but clearly heard conversations of the people in the next room, but this was not enough of an issue that it would deter us staying again in the future. Overall, very happy with our choice to stay here. All properties near the historic district are expensive but this wasn't any worse than others in the area with the special they were offering. If an affordable room was available on our next trip we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Unfortunately, I have forgotten his name, but to the gentleman working the check-in desk late at night on October 24th, thank you! Your customer service skills are outstanding and contributed much to our high level of satisfaction.

12028922379vicrob2131512False7FalseFalse3California, USA10/[YEAR-0]10/31/[YEAR-0]Rooms are old, dirty and in desperate need of renovation.3Beautiful location, Hotel needs renovationMixed feelings. Love this location in Poipu. Staff is very friendly, especially valet team. Bags delivered to room immediately. The problem - and it is a big one: this hotel is WAY over due for a renovation. I've stayed twice in the last 5 years and both times was disgusted by the condition of the room. Battled ants in [YEAR-4] and last week - what appeared to be tiny roaches? Mattresses are old, carpet is stained and filthy. The bathroom walls have not been wiped down in DECADES. And the grout in the tub/shower area is nearly black with grime. The room smells old and musty. I thought my experience in [YEAR-4] was a fluke - I now know this is just the condition of this sub-standard facility. It's really a shame because the beach location is wonderful. One shouldn't have to feel like they need a shower after stepping out of the hotel shower. I would be embarrassed to recommend this location to anyone (without a huge warning/disclaimer about the rooms). For this reason, I won't return until they renovate. Too many other options available in that price range.

12039460434NewMrsZ23232False5FalseFalse210/[YEAR-0]10/31/[YEAR-0]Wedding Weekend choiceWe chose to stay at the Belvoir for our wedding weekend because of a great stay a few years back. I was counting on a stress free stay since we had so much stress from the wedding already. From the moment of check-in, however, our stay was anything but stress-free. There was only one cart available when we unloaded so we had to wait a few minutes for one to be available to us. Then at the desk, we were less than an hour before rehearsal and they would not let me check in because the reservation was under my husband's name, even though I called twice before to confirm that there would be no issue. The gentleman at the front desk offered no options or help of any kind, which made me even more upset. Finally we were able to get up to our room and when we did, there was a soaking wet towel in the bathtub. Housekeeping did come up to take care of it right away. The elevators were incredibly slow. We waited at least 5 minutes each time, even though there are 3 elevators. Then on check out, there was a waiting list for luggage carts so we ended up taking our belongings, including my wedding dress and steamer, down in a few loads to the car. Positives: the food from room service wasn't bad and the bed was comfortable. There was no mini-fridge, which was disappointing, and the room we stayed in was pretty worn. On our previous stay, the room was much nicer. I would recommend the hotel for one reason, the location. You can't beat it but I wouldn't pay for this hotel if it wasn't where it is.

12051893942Cheryl2934343True53TrueFalse2Florida10/[YEAR-0]10/31/[YEAR-0]2Comfortable RoomI stayed two nights for a conference being held in the hotel. My room was comfortable and the bed was extremely comfortable (with plenty of pillows and high quality linen). However, my room overlooked the atrium and it was very noisy on both nights. Apparently, there were two big events going on, but that was small consolation for my lack of sleep. I think the rooms that face onto the atrium need some extra sound-proofing, or some other method has to be devised to limit the sound. I'd advise anyone booking the hotel to ask for a room that faces outwards from the atrium, not inwards.

Their service and facilities paled in comparison to what we experienced during our 10 Days at the Belvoir Buena Vista. We visit Disney once or twice a year and will stay here from now on.
